title: Micheál Martin - Wikipedia
snippet: In a cabinet reshuffle in January 2000, Martin was appointed Minister for Health and Children. Martin's predecessor, Brian Cowen, described the position as "like being in Angola", because 'landmines' can go off at any time.

title: Micheal Martin | Taoiseach, Previous Offices, & Family Tragedy | Britannica
snippet: The principal challenge facing him was to build on the largely successful response of his predecessor, Leo Varadkar, to the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 global pandemic, which had reached Ireland in early 2020.

title: Minister: Micheál Martin
snippet: After lengthy negotiations, he ... served as Taoiseach for the first half of the five-year term, with his predecessor Leo Varadkar as Tánaiste....

title: Micheál Martin - Taoiseach and Uachtarán Fhianna Fáil. TD for Cork South Central. | LinkedIn
snippet: Taoiseach and Uachtarán Fhianna Fáil. TD for Cork South Central. · Taoiseach and Uachtarán Fhianna Fáil, TD for Cork South Central. Tánaiste & Minister for Foreign Affairs & Minister for Defence from 2022 to 2025. Taoiseach from 2020 to 2022 Elected Uachtarán Fhianna Fáil on the 26th of January 2011 Minister for Foreign Affairs (May 2008 - January 2011) Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment (September 2004 - May 2008) Minister for Health and Children (January 2000 - September 2004) Minister for Education (June 1997 - January 2000) Fianna Fáil Front Bench spokesperson on Education and the Gaeltacht (1995 - 1997) I am a former Chairman of the Oireachtas All Party Committee on the Irish Language.

title: Taoiseach Micheál Martin TD
snippet: Micheál Martin was born in Turners Cross, Cork, the son of Paddy Martin, formerly of CIE and ex-Irish International boxer, and Lana Corbett. He was educated locally, at Scoil Chríost Rí and Coláiste Chríost Rí, and remains a frequent visitor to both schools.
